alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:27AM EST until December 20 at 5:14AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Penobscot River At Eddington affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River above Dover-Foxcroft. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, In Dover-Foxcroft, flood waters reach the low section of Pine Street near the intersection of South Street. Parking lot and recreational field off of Moosehead Lane inundated. Backyards of properties on Grange, Greene, and Riverside Ave flooded. In Guilford, properties south of Water Street along Old Railroad Grade and River Street are surrounded by floodwaters. At 15.0 feet, In Dover-Foxcroft, flood waters reach South Street at the intersection of Pine and Lawrence Streets. In Guilford, water reaches lower portions of Main Street and Water Street. At 17.0 feet, Flooding reaches School Street in Guilford and State Route 15 in Dover-Foxcroft. Fast moving water inundates South Street and low lying properties along East Main Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Flooding is Ongoing - Emergency management reports extensive flooding from Abbot to Dover-Foxcroft. Numerous roads are flooded and closed in Guilford and Dover-Foxcroft. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.6 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 04/28/1979. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 700 PM EST.
